text: Obey the speed limit; the faster you go the longer it will take you to stop.
Be aware of local traffic laws and rules of the road.
Stay out of a driver's blind spot; Signal well in advance of any change in direction
Check Hydraulic and Coolant fluids weekly.
Test for high and low beams (make sure that all lights are functioning)
Avoid bad weather. Slippery conditions reduce your margin for error.
NEVER RIDE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR OTHER DRUGS
Prefer to go through areas with less traffic or just start early. You will enjoy it more.
While riding in the rain brake slowly and accelerate slowly.
Wear all the gear. ( Helmet Gloves Jacket Pants and boots ).
Use indicators while changing lanes or overtaking.
Check for proper tyre pressure, as it ensures good road grip.
Check the brakes. They should be in proper conditions and not loose.
Give your bike full maintenance as needed. Never compromise on quality.
Donï¿½t get tempted to race, as it is considered that street racers are weak minded and irresponsible.
Be aware of road surfaces.  You may not see sand, but it's as slippery as ice.  Also wet leaves can be very treacherous.
Be aware of blind spots of other drivers.  If you can't see their eyes, they cannot see you.  That's especially true when following a big truck.
Keep good braking distance. If you stay back then you have way more time to react if the driver ahead does something weird.
